attributes.comment:
I think the proposed fee increase would unduly burden new immigrants who are
seeking legal methods to work and live in the US. Right now the major reasons
people come to the US is to be able to work to improve their lives back home. If
they had the funds already they wouldn't be coming here. I think by increasing the
cost unnecessarily, fewer people will be able to legally immigrate and more people
will turn to alternative immigration resources. If the increease funds could
guarantee an increase in customer service or a more sophisticated processing
method, or new equipment to make the process faster and more efficient then this
should be explained at the time of the increase. From my understandign of the
situation there is no benefit to the immigration process from the immigrants view.
Already a student who is gettign an education inthe US is not eligible for any sort
of aid and is paying the most of all students for tuituion(ie $32,000.00/yr) and can
only work on campus for 20hrs per week at $5.15/hr can not afford to pay over
$300.00 for a work permit for 3mo in summer and then re-apply again for the same
cost during their winter break for 1mo. This is too burdensome. If the fees are to
increase there should be some legal means of meeting the fee cost. When you
consider that previous immigrants paid $0.50 to immigrate for life to the US, one
can not help but wonder if because of the skin of current immigrants people feel it
is more acceptable to penalize and restrict them to this unconstitutional degree.
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Anonymous
